speaker: Jordi Cabana
transcript: of the things that we can. Okay so that's the first one. And while we're doing this we also want to go around the room and do brief introductions just a few seconds. You want to say your name and affiliation and just a very short description of what your research interests are. For your reference you all put videos introducing yourselves so you have a longer version of it and so if somebody's interested in somebody else you also have the option of going to watch the video or you know connect separately. In the interest of time I ask you that you that you're brief to one liner of who you are. So I am going to go in the order just to be structured in the order that I see people listed on the participant list. Just you know I don't have a physical thing to be going around so I figured it'd be easier. So Adam would you mind starting? Holewinski.
other: The speaker is facilitating the meeting and establishing the process for introductions.

Coordination and Decision Practices.explanation: The speaker structures the meeting by outlining the process for brief introductions, specifying the content, and setting a time constraint ('brief to one liner').
Coordination and Decision Practices.score_justification: The utterance provides explicit goals (brief introductions, one-liner) and a detailed method for coordination (going in order of participant list), effectively structuring the team's activity.

Participation Dynamics.explanation: The speaker explicitly states the method for managing contributions ('I am going to go in the order... listed on the participant list') and directly invites Adam to start the introductions.
Participation Dynamics.score_justification: The speaker uses a targeted and structured approach to invite participation, ensuring an organized and balanced distribution of speaking turns.

speaker: Adam Holewinski

Knowledge Sharing.score_justification: The utterance provides accurate and detailed information about Adam's affiliation and specific research interests, which is directly useful for team members to understand his expertise and potential contributions to the collaboration.

Relational Climate.explanation: Adam's opening 'Sure yeah' expresses a cooperative and agreeable tone in response to Jordi's request for introductions, contributing positively to the interpersonal climate.
Relational Climate.score_justification: The phrase 'Sure yeah' is a clear and polite acknowledgment of the request, showing willingness to participate and contributing positively to the team's relational climate.
